Description: Rim/body sherd of black figure North Ionian pottery plate; interior: whitish slip; rim brownish black with added red band and a white band in groove at junction with body; horse (head and most of forelegs lost; red on neck; collar (?) decorated with alternating pendant white strokes and pomegranates with red centres; red stroke on flank; on lower part of tail, six knots or baubles) and rider (long hair, short chiton with decorated top; holding reins in raised right hand and a goad (?) in his left) to left; small figure (possibly a child or eidolon, wearing red cap and short garment once either red or white) in mid-air to left; dancer (left arm and left lower leg lost; perhaps wearing phorbeia; red 'loincloth’ with white band above waist; red dots on calf muscles) to left, looking back; underside: whitish slip with brown bands and lines.
Curator's comments: Joined to sherd 1888.6-1.551. Probably also belongs with GR 1888.6-1.552 and GR 1888.6-1.560
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.54, 56, 57 fig.4, Table 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.810)
